  6794. it's a hot mess!
  6795. I have not noticed a huge difference in my skin, perhaps a little less breaking out, but I cannot say that it's from using this item.
  6796. I sound like a bad commercial, but it's true.
  6797. The top spout is small enough to let out trickles, so you don't waste toner by oversoaking.
  6798. After washing my face with either Dr. Bronner's Pure Castile Soap or Dr. Woods Black Soap, I take a cotton pad, liberally squirt on the Thayers Witch Hazel, rub the cotton against the solid sea salt bar and use it as a facial toner and as a toner to eliminate razor bumps after shaving.
  6799. are the reason I have clear skin (I've been struggling with slight adult acne).
  6800. It doesn't feel nearly as drying as my previous witch hazel that had alcohol in it and makes my skin feel so soft.
  6801. IF YOU ARE A BIT SENSITIVE TO SCENTS, BE WARY THAT IT MAY BE STRONG TO YOU.
  6802. Soothing and gentle, my skin doesn't feel tight after using it either.

  6804. I'm not sure what other fragrances are available.

All Reviews

  1. Doesn't have the cooling effect of an alcohol based toner.<br />My skin didn't break out when using it, but it also didn't seem to pick up that much dirt compared to an OTC toner such as clean & clear.<br /><br />I think it's a good buy for the price, but I'm not sold that witch hazel has any advantages over other toners. If you want to use a non-alcohol based toner though, I think this is a good product.
  2. I have tried a couple different witch hazels but this is by far the best. It smells great and doesn't have that potent smell witch hazel usually has. I don't have dry skin but found that witch hazel would dry my skin out and it would take a couple of days for my skin to return to normal. This doesn't dry my skin out at all and I feel refreshed after using it. It does the job of witch hazel but actually soothes my skin and leaves my skin soft and feeling hydrated. I will be purchasing this product for a long time to come.
  3. LOVED the smell and feel.

  47.   90. Let's start with my skin type. As a fellow online shopper, I think it's important to know the reviewers skin type so I can compare with my own. SUPER OILY.<br />How oily? Let's put it this way. On average I use 4-6 oil blotting papers each time to remove shine. I do this 2-3 times a day to not look like butter. My supposedly long lasting 15-h foundation only lasts 2 hours before melting and I don't use eyeliner (even though I would love to!) because my eye lids melt everything; pencil, gel, powder, liquid. Anything. That is how oily I am. To add to my problems, I also have mild acne. I treat this with benzoid peroxide face wash, retinoid cream, and benzoid peroxide gel daily. I am simply adding the toner to my routine so any results or side effects are achieved with a combination of products. I will report as accurately as possible.<br /><br />Now back to the product.<br /><br />Day 1: I received the package very quickly and at first I was a little apprehensive because the liquid looked like baby oil inside the bottle. Later at night, I finally opened it and I was wrong. The toner is very light, non-greasy, and smelled like roses. The smell was a bit strong when I first poured it on a cotton pad, but about 5 minutes after application, 95% of the smell went away. So for those who are worried about the scent, it goes away quickly! After applying the toner on my face I felt very clean and normal. I say normal meaning I didn't fee dry and I didn't feel oily either. It was great. I followed quickly with my usual moisturizer and voila. Done.<br /><br />Day 2: I woke up and my face was not as oily as before, pre-toner. Upon washing my face, it felt softer and smoother. Definite plus. After using the toner only once, I am already feeling a difference. Overall, my skin feels cleaner and less heavy with oil. If your goal is to find something to clean and sooth, this toner does a pretty good job. As for pore sizes or acne, I will have to update after I've used the products fora few weeks. I'm going to add the toner to my routine twice a day as recommended and will update soon!<br /><br />One Month Later: I have lowered my use to once a day, at night, to clear away any excess dirt or makeup that was overlooked by the makeup remover + face wash. Aside from what I mentioned earlier, I did not notice any additional benefit of this toner. It definitely does help keep my pores cleaner but after a while, I still need to use clay masks or nose strips to remove the blackheads. Overall, I would say that using this toner wouldn't hurt. I observed no negative reactions and it's quite affordable as a toner for only $10!<br /><br />Recommendations: For anyone looking for a general toner that covers all your bases, I would recommend this one due to its low costs and large quantity. (After one month, I barely used half the bottle.) For anyone looking to target anything specific like oiliness, acne, pores, etc, I would recommend to possibly keep shopping. Let me be clear that this toner is not bad, in fact, it's a lot better than other toners I've tried because it didn't dry out my skin, but it also did not fulfill the hopes that I had when trying it. If you have relatively good skin, go for it. This one is both good for your wallet and skin.

  242. I ordered this product on Sept. 23rd and received it today, October 6th. It was well-packaged and when I opened it, it smelled very good. It has a nice, light fragrance, hence the 3 stars. Too bad I can't use it!<br /><br />Upon reading the full ingredients listed on the bottle I found that it contains grapefruit seed extract (I seriously don't know how I missed this fact when reading the product details! I ALWAYS read the ingredients list...I'm almost positive that the description did NOT include this fact at the time I decided to purchase). Anyhow, those of you on statin medication know that we're not allowed to ingest grapefruit as \\"It can interact with cholesterol-fighting statin drugs by increasing the amounts of those medications in the bloodstream.\\" Also, \\"The compound bergamottin is found in grapefruit, and when it interacts with certain enzyme systems in the body, it can prevent these enzymes from breaking down statins, which causes the drug to accumulate in high levels in the body. Some of the conditions this can cause are liver damage and rhabdomyolysis (severe muscle and kidney damage).\\"<br /><br />Since anything we put on our bodies is absorbed through our skin and into our bloodstream, I think I'll err on the side of caution and refrain from using this product :(

I have had faster results than any medications, than any pretty packaging promising the moon--with basic, simple, honest, and natural products.

  421. LOVE THIS STUFF! I simultaneously have acne issues and dry skin. This witch hazel stops my skin from feeling tight after being washed, and make my skin feel silky smooth. It's a very lightweight liquid and isn't greasy in the slightest. And it has a really nice, light scent. Highly recommend!
  422. Remember the old cat lady down the street when you were growing up? They took her, put her in a juicer, then put the smell into this Witch Hazel. Great for cat ladies, no so much for me.
  423. Normally I would be hesitant to give a product, especially a beauty/cosmetic product, five stars, but I absolutely love this product, and I think it would be useful to many people and non-irritating/not a waste of money to people who end up not loving it.<br />I initially receieved a small sample bottle from a tradeshow and then purchased the larger bottle online after using it all. I have been using it daily for approximately three months and have found it great for the following uses:<br /><br />-As a facial toner/acne treatment: I apply it every night after washing my face. It helps remove leftover makeup and makes my skin feel clean without the \\"tingly\\" sensation (code: burning) or tightness I've experience with other toners. It makes my skin feel soothed rather than attacked. Whenever I've had a breakout, it has helped reduce the size and redness of blemishes overnight, and made them feel less hot and irritated instantly. I previously had light acne around my hairline due to my bangs, and it has cleared up completely. I occasionally get cystic pimples, almost always due to PMS, and it clears those up faster than anything without dryness. When I've had those type of blemishes, I've applied this to a washcloth with hot water and used it as a compress, and the acne has looked and felt better immediately.<br /><br />-As an aftershave: I use this when shaving my bikini area. It is very soothing and cooling, and I'm not worried about using any of the ingredients around sensitive parts of my body. Even better, I haven't had a single ingrown hair since I started using it. I apply immediately after shaving and whenever I feel chaffed. I also exfoliate to prevent ingrown hairs, but this is the first product that has prevented them completely. This is the number one reason I ordered the large bottle.<br /><br />-To freshen up in general: When I have been particularly sweaty for whatever reason, I've put this on a tissue or and used it to freshen my face, underarms, cleavage, neckline, etc. It evaporates quickly, is cooling and smells fresh without being overpowering. It's nice during a long commute or after the gym.<br /><br />I can see how some people would not like the scent even though I like it. It is not a strong, long lasting or perfumey scent, but it is definitely very rosy. Some people might associate the smell with \\"grandma\\" since rose petal is a classic scent that was very popular for cosmetics and fragrances in earlier decades. If you find that off putting, I would recommend trying another one of the available scents because I do think it is a great product.
  424. Best toner! I used to use Clinique's #2 toner but I read it has alcohol in it. I was trying to find a toner than gave me the same clean feel without the alcohol and this toner does it! I have really oily and fairly acne prone skin. This toner doesn't break me out and it gets rid of the grime without drying me out. I use it once in the morning after I've washed my face. And twice at night - I don't wash my face at night so I clean it twice with this toner. This toner smells like rose water, which is okay. Roses are not my favorite scent but the scents goes away pretty quickly so it's not a big deal. I've also tried the lavender scented toner - I like this rose scented one more. The lavender smells almost medicinal.

I like it to tingle and maybe even burn a little, so I know my pores are tightened, and I like it to leave my skin enough natural oils so that it doesn't work extra hard to replace them and thus make my skin greasy. Since I was 14<br />I have used a lot of Clinique's toner for combination/oily skin, which seems to do all the things I want, but the alcohol strips my skin of its natural oils and can make my face red and blotchy. I've used a<br />whole bottle of witch hazel and liked it. It didn't leave the cotton ball dirty or make my skin tingle, but it left the natural oils. So, so far it's been a catch-22 and in the mean time I got a generic &#34;sensitive skin astringent&#34; from the dollar store which pretty much works great, but has a smell I don't like. If you don't use it every day you can pour it in a spray bottle and spritz your face to feel fresh whenever you need.<br /><br />protip: do not travel with this bottle. It leaks, they all leak, no matter what you do. no, taping it shut won't help. either (1) put some cotton pads in a ziploc baggie and pour the witch hazel over them until they're soaked or (2) just get a cheap little travel bottle that squeezes (like $0.50 at REI) so you don't have to deal with spills every trip. it will spill whether you travel in a plane or a car.

  802. I've been using this product 2x daily along with black soap for just one week, and my bumps have reduced dramatically in size and prevalence. Ever since puberty hit me, I've had an issue with small, hard bumps that have plagued my forehead, temples, and even my cheeks. The bumps never amounted to pimples (but I still DID get pimples), and it was highly noticeable, especially if the light hit me just right. It has always been embarrassing, especially since other people have actually asked me about the bumps. &#34;Do you have sun poisoning or something?&#34; So yeah, I'm super self-conscious about it. I've tried so many different facial products - scrubs, masks, different face washes, astringents, toners, and so on - and none of that other stuff helped with the bumps. I eat healthy and drink water like I should, but it didn't help. With Thayers Witch Hazel, I feel like I've finally found the product that works for me, and the difference is noticeable even though I've only been using it for a week!<br /><br />The second-best thing about this product is how my face hasn't dried out at all. I have the type of skin that can get oily, but my skin still flaked, especially on my nose and forehead. My face has NOT been flaky at all after I started using this product. My skin is very smooth, and I find myself rubbing my face with my hands to feel the smoothness!<br /><br />I am definitely sticking with this product. I haven't had a single pimple develop since I started it, the bumps are shrinking and vanishing, and I feel like I'm actually taking care of the skin that I have. Everyone always talks about scrubs and exfoliation, but I feel like the RIGHT way to go is to nourish the skin, and this product does exactly that. The icing on the cake is that it's natural.   837. What's the second ingredient in Dr. Perricone's Super Detox Elixir? What's the second ingredient in Murad Clarifying Toner? What's the second ingredient in Olek Henriksen Grease Relief Face Tonic? I could go on and on.....but I'll just let you know. It's witch hazel, which you can find in your local pharmacy for a few bucks, is a great astringent. And its one in its purest form.<br /><br />What is witch hazel? It is the leaves and bark of the North American shrub known as Hamamelis Virginiana (sometimes you might see this on a label as an ingredient in your favorite toner or astringent instead of the words \\"witch hazel\\"). Witch hazel naturally grows in Nova Scotia in Canada, and Florida in the United States.<br /><br />Witch hazel can be used for so many things but using it as your daily astringent can not only give you great skin but also a lot of bang for your buck! In addition, witch hazel is an herbal and natural product and thus it is great for sensitive skin. You can apply it after shaving, waxing and any kind of skin care regimen.<br /><br />There is a reason you can find witch hazel in so many skin care products. It has so many benefits: it reduces excess sweating and oil secretion, helps with large pores, treats acne, and helps with various other skin conditions. The astringent also has anti-inflammatory properties. If you have ever had a facial, you will notice that usually after extractions, your aesthetician will apply with hazel to your skin. Witch hazel can also help prevent the development of acne as well as treat existing acne and pimples. This is the reason why it is frequently used in acne skin care products.<br /><br />Another approach for using witch hazel astringent is treating psoriasis, dermatitis, eczema, diaper rash and poison ivy rash in the natural way. Witch hazel is also one of the best herbal remedies for alleviating sunburns and windburns.<br /><br />And the best part is that you can pick it up at your local pharmacy for about five bucks! Hope you enjoyed this skincents tip! For more tips and reviews visit pimples and wrinkles. And look out for the launch of our new site this month which will feature product reviews, treatment reviews and spa reviews. See you at pimples and wrinkles!ve bucks!   946. So as every lady online knows, your skin care regimen evolves and changes, and it's often difficult to find new products that work as well as your old, but after a while your skin's PH balance gets used to the products and poof--it's time to find new product for yourself. I heard that witch hazel was good to use as a toner as long as it is paraben-free, and decided to do a search to find the best. Well, in the expensive all organic deli near my house, I found this brand as the only one that wasn't full of alcohol and paraben, but it was so expensive I couldn't bear to buy it even though I read online that it was a good one. This is where the internet always comes in these days.<br /><br /> I found it on Amazon for nearly half the cost as the one in my deli. So I ordered two, and had them shipped to my apartment. After first use, I felt like it was a little too harsh with my cetaphil, so I tried it with [[ASIN:B00LFT0CEO TreeActiv+ Tea Tree Oil Acne Solution for Advanced Acne Treatment - All Natural Acne Spot Treatment - Blemishes Gone or Your Money Back!]] that my sister bought me (also on Amazon, we really can use the internet for everything, huh?) and this was a way better combination. Since the Tea Tree face wash and oil are richer in the oils that my combination skins, the witch hazel acts as a sort of in between step for the two that makes sure that it isn't too much oil, and you still get the moisturizing aspect. I also use a [[[ASIN:B00U1J83SQ TreeActiv Anti Acne & Rosacea Treatment Sulfur Mask Plus Rhassoul, Bentonite Clay Mask with Witch Hazel & Aloe Vera - Refreshing Lemon Scent (1 Jar)]] that does the trick as well. I definitely recommend using them all together if you have combination skin, the tea tree products moisturize my skin and fight acne, and the witch hazel acts as an astringent, making sure my skin isn't too oily, and also fighting the acne. Bonus: all of these products smell amazing, so score on that!

IMO it's a giant waste of money to use expensive treatment serums on your skin, unless it's been fully prepared to absorb it. Staying in the shower longer than you absolutely must will cause the skin to lift and peel.   1432. I have recently been trying to find a more natural and organic skin care routine. I have combination skin that can be a bit sensitive. I also have an uneven skin tone.For awhile now I have been using this routine:<br /><br />Dr Woods Black Soap with shea butter as a facial cleanser and body wash<br />Witch Hazel for a facial toner<br />Burts Bees Radiance Day Cream as a daytime moisturizer<br />Rosehip Oil for a night time moisturizer<br /><br />I also use an Aztec Clay Mask once a week for a deep clean.<br />Coconut Oil for an overall body lotion.<br />And I use a Konjac Sponge for a more natural version of a loofah.<br /><br />I am so far really loving this routine. I find it makes my skin very clean and surprisingly soft. The smell is okay. It smells like...well, soap. It does not smell like you are in a field of flowers or surrounded by mangoes like most beauty products do, but I am okay with that. I do not find the smell bad at all, just different then what I am used to from more normal products. It can also be used to wash your hair, but I have yet to try that. I have however tried it as a cleaner while doing the dishes and I found it worked well as a household cleaner as well.<br /><br />I love witch hazel. It is a great toner. It feels refreshing and exactly like any other toner I have ever used. But it is better as I feel a sense of joy everytime I use it as I know I am not putting any weird harsh chemicals on my skin when using it. If you don’t use toners, I highly recommend it. There are plenty of websites out there that show all the benefits of using a toner between a cleanser and a moisturizer.<br /><br />The Burts Bees Day Cream. I love the smell, it is in a cute little bottle, and my skin feels ready to tackle the day after using it. I am a big fan of most of the Burts Bees products so it makes sense that I like this too. I will however attempt to just use rosehip oil as a moisturizer once this cream is gone, simply because it would be more simplistic to just have 1 and it will save me some money. If that doesn’t work, I will gladly reorder this cream.<br /><br />Rosehip Oil is my new love when it comes to beauty products. It has recently gained popularity when model Miranda Kerr admitted to using it nightly on her skin. The smell isn’t good or bad. Meaning that it doesn’t smell wonderful like a perfume, but the smell isn’t bad and take away from the awesomeness of this product. If you don’t like the smell of it, don’t worry. It absorbs very quickly into your skin and the smell goes away once it does. It makes my skin so SMOOTH! And as I said, it absorbs very quickly which I love. I only use around 2-3 drops a night to cover my whole face. SO it will last quite awhile. I also love all the benefits it has. Again, there are plenty of websites out there that preach the amazing reasons to use this essential oil.<br /><br />I am sure by now we all know the lovely product that is coconut oil. It makes a fantastic lotion. My skin has never been more smooth in my life. The only downside in my opinion is it does not absorb quite as fast into my skin as the rosehip oil does. So I usually put this on first and let it start to work and then do the rest of my routine( hair, brush teeth, face, etc).<br /><br />The Aztec Clay Mask is such a simplistic face mask, yet it works better than any I have every used. It is especially useful for people who struggle with acne. I simply mix it with some Apple Cider Vinegar and put it on. I think go do a few chores like the dishes or starting laundry. I wash it off in the shower. Some don’t prefer to do this, but I haven’t had any problems doing so and I prefer to do it this way as it makes less of a mess in my opinion. I strongly encourage you all to try it.<br /><br />The Konjac Sponges are a newaddition to my routine. They are made from a plant root and another natural ingredient. They are expected to last around 3 months. Even longer if you take better care of them. They are so soft! And I can already tell it helps make my skin more smooth. I find them to definitely be a positive addition to my skincare routine and will be buying more. I use the pink clay facial sponge for my face cleaning. The pink clay helps with dry skin and uneven skin tone. There are a lot of varieties of different ingredients added to the sponges, so I am sure you can find one that works best for your skin. I then use the red clay body sponge for the same reasons. I have really dry skin and these help. I also feel a bit indulgent every time I use them because of how soft they are!<br /><br />I hope this has helped if you are like me and looking to lessen the amount of chemicals you put on your skin. Next I plan to try and make a more natural hair care routine, and then find natural alternatives for deodorant and toothpaste.

I'm quite a bit past puberty, but I still break out like a teenager with regularity and was getting tired of it. Cue this toner.<br /><br />I began regular applications of it in the morning after waking up, after getting out of the shower, and occasionally before going to sleep. At the beginning I did not notice a great deal of difference in my complexion, but I did notice that it did not make my face red like other toners I had tried immediately after using it. After a few weeks, I noticed the amount of acne I was getting was smaller and the existing acne itself was smaller in size and clearing up faster.<br /><br />Now, two months later I still occasionally have a zit or two, but my complexion is much clearer and my acne scars seem to be fading somewhat.<br /><br />All in all, I will by this product again!

Although I am actually 48, people say I look much younger. Make no mistake, I have used those in the past. Let's chalk that episode up to the ignorance of youth. For a short time in my 20's, I mistakenly drew a correlation between cost and quality. Fortunately, I saw the light before those products could do any serious damage. Now, I keep it simple and basic.<br /><br />As a matter of full disclosure, I use Thayers Witch Hazel in conjunction with a himalayan sea salt bar. After washing my face with either Dr. Bronner's Pure Castile Soap or Dr. Woods Black Soap, I take a cotton pad, liberally squirt on the Thayers Witch Hazel, rub the cotton against the solid sea salt bar and use it as a facial toner and as a toner to eliminate razor bumps after shaving. To moisturize, I either use organic coconut oil or Organix' Theraneem Skin Lotion.

Especially on my nose. Big wow for this one.<br /><br />Eczema: I tend to get eczema on my face which really sucks. This takes it right away!! Thank you ,thank you. For those of you that suffer with eczema my number one recommendation is to stop eating grain!! That makes a HUGE difference. That is the only way I can get rid of it. When I cheat my body can handle it once in a while but no on a regular base. When I start eating grain it comes back. And then Thank goodness for Witch Hazel it takes it away quickly. I have used steroid creams which work, but this is actually faster and all natural!<br /><br />Wrinkles: Yes, it does help. I feel my skin is tighter and I a youthful glow back to my skin. It really is amazing. I'm 58 and look 40. What I eat makes a difference there too but Witch Hazel is fantastic. (food, stay away from sugar!! Ages you fast.) I never bothered with an astringent. What for. I have no idea what started me on it but I will never stop.<br />Cleans: I know it moisturizes. I am not sure how but it does. I still feel squeaky clean, I put the witch hazel on t though out the day. I leave it on the bathroom counter next to cotton balls and whenever I am there I put some more on. Love it.<br /><br />Acne: I don't and never have had a problem with acne but Every once in a while one will sneak up, usually back to when I am not eating right. It does clear it up quickly when I use the witch hazel. I would say in two days. For those who say it brings on acne my only guess to that is it might be clearing out your skin big time and...what are you eating?? Can't blame it all on the witch hazel.<br /><br />Good stuff. I noticed there is lavender and many other choices. A real keeper as far as I am concerned!!

I noticed something crawling on my hand (the hand I used to apply the toner) it was a wasp. I tried blowing it off, but it stayed on. Finally I brushed it off with my keys and ran.<br /><br />Next I went to the park with my son and I felt something crawling on my face. I swiped it off and saw that it was a bumblebee. It was a beautiful sunny day so maybe they were just out in full force.<br /><br />When I went home I was taking my son out of the car and I felt something crawling on my hand again. It was another bumblebee. I usually don't attract bees. They avoid me and I them for the most part. I thought it was a little odd that I had these experiences.<br /><br />It won't stop me from using the toner, but I just wanted to warn others in case you're allergic to bees.

At first, like any product my face turned dry/pinkish/red for the first 2 uses. Then my skin got adjusted to it and worked great. I think it has even helped my breaking out. Another tip, I dab the toner with cotton pad, I do not rub across my face. I noticed with any toner I have used, rubbing across my face and pimples only spread more bacteria and broke me out more. Dabbing helped get rid of acne and not spread it more.<br /><br />I highly recommend this product! I'm on my third bottle now! Love it more than everrr!

As much as I wanted to like this product, every way I tried to use it, it just didn't work out.<br /><br />I've been trying to keep my facial routine as natural as possible, washing with raw honey and using alba botanica's aloe&green tea oil-free moisturizer, but I decided that I wanted to use a toner. My face is more of a normal-combination (normally, not to oily, but not too dry), but I had some bad break outs in the past that left some discolored scars/skin and I heard that witch hazel and rose water can help reverse those.<br /><br />When I came across this product in my search, and saw that they sold it at Whole Foods, I gave it a go.<br />My face had started breaking out randomly, so when I began using the toner after washing and before moisturizing, and found even more break outs day after day.<br />I wanted to give it a chance and thought maybe it was my skin \\"purging\\" or the \\"fragrance\\" in it was causing the problem. I like the scent of roses and I didn't think the smell was overpowering, but I read other reviews on other sites with people stating the same problem - the fragrance was breaking them out because their skin was/is sensitive to most fragrances.<br />So, I went back to Whole Foods and bought the alcohol-free, unscented toner. I gave myself a few days of not using the Rose scented one to give my face a break, but when I started using the unscented one, the same thing happened, I got small breaks outs again, just not as severely.<br /><br />At this point, I decided to cut my losses and stopped using it on my face, but I had read that it could be used as an aftershave and, so I gave that a go instead of returning it.<br />Nope. Didn't work. My face cooled down and stopped breaking out, but I started getting a fair amount of weird pimples and breakouts and ingrown hairs on my legs which very very very rarely happens.<br />I used both the rose and the unscented one as well as new razor blades, just in case it was my blade, and not the toner.<br />I don't know why it would cause this kind of reaction, especially since I use body lotions that have oils in them as well as aloe gel for my face after my moisturizer. My face isn't severely sensitive either, so.<br /><br />I wish it would have worked out, because it did work. Aside from the breakouts, old scars were fading, dark circles under my eyes looked lighter and less puffy, and I did like leaving the bathroom smelling of roses, but it would be a really strange catch-22 to use something that's helping remove old scars but replacing them with new ones.<br />I'm glad it works for others, but I'll continue my search for a good toner if I find I need it (i've recently changed to using derma e products), and just wear rose perfume, haha!

  2010. Use:<br />For use as a daily facial toner, makeup remover, light moisturizer.<br /><br />Ingredients:<br />Purified Water, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice (Certified Organic Filet of Aloe Vera), Glycerin (Vegetable), Fragrence (Natural Rose), Hamamelis Virgiana (THAYERS proprietary un-distilled Certified Organic Witch Hazel) Extract, Rose Centifolia (Rose) Flower Water, Citric Acid Citrus Grandis (Grapefruit) Seed Extract, Tocopheryl (Vitamin E) Acetate<br /><br />Personal Experience:<br />Let me start off by saying I LOVE using witch hazel as a facial toner/cleaner/astringent.<br />I purchased this product from Natural Grocers because they didn't have Humphrey's Witch Hazel (the brand I used to use). I've heard good things about rose water for your skin so I decided to try it. I've used this product 2-3x a day for about a month.<br /><br />Pros:<br />It works great as a light moisturizer. I can wash my face with a 2% Salicylic Wash (pretty darn drying) and then apply this toner and I don't have to apply lotion.<br />It smells nice.<br />Aloe and Rose water are supposed to be beneficial to skin.<br />It cleans dirt off of my skin, it's satisfying to see the dirty cotton ball and know that dirt is no longer on your face!<br />On par with Humphrey's Witch Hazel.<br />The ingredients are natural and I haven't experienced any irritation or allergic reactions.<br /><br />Cons:<br />When I use this product in the morning or during the day it makes my face oily. However, it is summer time so perhaps I will not experience this effect so much in the winter.<br />I think if this product didn't have glycerin in it, I wouldn't be experiencing an excessive oil issue.<br />Glycerin can also cause allergic reactions in some people.<br /><br />Overall, I like this product. It is effective at removing dirt from the day. It doesn't seem to be helping or hurting my current mild-moderate acne (but I believe it is mostly hormonal). I wish it didn't make my face oily, so when I run out of this bottle I'll wait until winter to buy another, and look for a different witch hazel product that doesn't contain glycerin.

It's really good for oily skin. Now, some reviewers may have mixed reviews if they have oily skin, but I found that this actually helped my oily skin by further removing impurities and dirt from my skin.<br /><br />As with any skin regime, it is important especially for those with oily skin as such as myself to follow up with a moisturizer after using a toner. Some think that with this toner they are done. Yes, your skin will feel tight without oil for the first few minutes, but the moisturizer is really important. I think that using a moisturizer or some type of light-weight oil has helped this product do wonders for my skin. Whenever I used the Thayer's toners on my skin, I receive plenty of compliments and I noticed the oil production is controlled.<br /><br />A great moisturizer that works for me is the Neutrogena SPF 15 (oily skin), and I apply a very light coating of almond oil before that. I use to fear using oil right after I washed my face since my skin is very oily, but the almond oil absorbs very quickly and helps create a smooth base/foundation for my moisturizer.<br /><br />I hope these tips help!

I am so happy with my purchase! The day my products arrived I mixed the Deep pore cleansing mask with apple cider vinegar and applied to my face as a mask. I plan on doing the mask once per week. When I wake up and before bed, I wash my face with Aquaphor Baby Gentle Wash & Tear Free Shampoo, Fragrance Free Mild Cleanser (I feel my face is just too oily to not wash with some form of soap), then I use the Thayers as a toner - focusing more on my problem areas and pimples. After letting my face air dry, I take a very small amount (about 1/8 of a teaspoon) of the Coconut Oil and mix it with 1-2 drops of the Jojoba Oil and rub all over my face. The oils do take a little while to absorb but once they do, my skin feels so soft and refreshed. I just started this routine 3 days ago and I am already seeing results. The pimples I had are already disappearing. My skin tone is evening out. My face is SO much less oily and my pores are minimizing. This morning I only had to put a small amount of BB cream and a very light amount of powder on my face (I am considering looking into home-making natural makeup as my next project). Iam loving the results so far!! I definitely recommend this product be added to your beauty routine.

I would say I noticed significant results within 18 hours of using it, and I maybe applied it four times in those 18 hours. The marks that I was also worried about disappeared within a few days and I am glad this might have saved me from a few small scars. I have used a lot of lavender products before and creamy rose products, but this seems to work way better on scars and skin tone in general due to the combined aloe/vitamin E/rose/ and even witch hazel. I will probably also will use a stronger rose-hip oil, non-creamy blend for scarring in the future since I have used this in addition to shea, cocoa, and conconut oil instead of the lavender oil-based products I have bought before.<br /><br />Now instead of using the alcohol to disinfect my skin in addition to a tea-tree oil cleanser, I am glad I switched to this in addition to a 10 percent, glycolic acid natural cleanser from Be Natural Organics and a stay-on 10 percent, glycolic acidnatural night cream from Reviva. So if you are like me and you like disinfecting your skin before you sleep in addition to using other body salves or creams, I think reviva would be a good night choice for disinfecting purposes in addition to taking a shower at night which also helps acne. A good exfoliator is also a good idea and my favorite is Acure's Brightening Facial Scrub. My other advice would be to try Cocoa-Nut Creme by AAA Shea butter for moisturizing among other scarring/aging purposes. The product DOES NOT have methylparaben and polysorbate 20 based on the picture of this product you click before it takes you to its page with an older picture and apparently ingredient list, and it is now completely natural and just uses vitamin E as a preservative. This is the third time I have either bought or noticed an inaccurate product ingredient list and am disappointed with amazon for being so bad at updating ingredient lists for better or for worse, but in this case it would be updated to a better list. So be careful to read reviews about skin products when buying from amazon because it seems to be a pretty frequent mistake on their part. In my case the products were Ann Webb's Coffee Cherry Eye and lip balm and also CoQ10 products by Avalon Organics.

  2335. I've gotten about halfway through my bottle, so I figure now's as good a time as any to leave a review.<br /><br />I never used a toner before, but apparently there's a bit of debate as to whether or not they're even worth it. The basic premise is that they can help clean out those last lingering bits of dirt and oil after cleansing your face (some people going so far as to argue that it \\"restores the pH balance of your skin\\" but I'm not so sure on that).<br /><br />After each cleansing, I dampen a cotton ball with this and pat/rub it on my face and neck. Sometimes it's a little tingly, but usually it's very refreshing! I'm a big fan of witch hazel, so I really like that this product is witch hazel based instead of alcohol.<br /><br />I don't have any miraculous claims about this product working wonders on my skin, but I don't really have any huge skin issues to begin with. I don't feel quite so oily, and I admit I like the cleansing feeling.<br /><br />However, I did have a nasty batch of ingrown hairs on my legs--the really awful sort with red, painful bumps and whatnot. On a whim I put a bit of this toner on, and while they weren't GONE, they were drastically reduced the next morning.

  2387. Let me start by saying, I initially hated this product, but I stuck through it for a few more days to see if there was any change in my skin, because I couldn't ignore all the positive reviews! And WOW. It is as good as people say.<br /><br />The first two days I used it were pretty bad. I have extremely sensitive and oily skin, so even if I put water on a cotton ball and rub it on my face, it will irritate me ): so I didn't blame the toner for any stinging. BUT, 20 or so minutes after applying this, my skin became SO over moisturized. I don't want to say oily, but it was more like the toner was being squeezed back out of my pores after it had been absorbed, and my face was basically wet! It sounds weird, I know, but after looking into it I found out a lot of people also experienced this! This happened every time I used it, so on the second day I decided to only use it before bed so I could moisturize at night and not have such an oily face during the day. Two more days passed, and my oily skin started to get better and the few blemishes I had around my chin and forehead started to minimize, and a full week later I'm happy to say my skin has NEVER felt or looked this good!<br /><br />I can feel that it's noticeably smoother, and my skin tone is a lot more even, my pores are a lot smaller and my favorite bit is that all my little blemishes/pimples have completely gone away! Also, day by day my skin became more tolerant of the toner and instead of the slight stinging I felt in the beginning, it now feels nice and refreshing on my skin. I've also shared this with my sister who has very dry patchy skin and she's also in love with it.<br /><br />My final advice is, sensitive skin, oily skin, dry skin, what have you, try it! You won't be sorry. And if you're not happy with it after the first or second use, keep at it for at least a week before passing judgement. I almost gave up on this product but I'm glad I didn't.

  2493. First, I don't usually leave feedback that isn't strictly related to how the product works BUT....<br /><br />I had this shipped to my office. When it arrived it was in a tall narrow plastic zip lock bag and had leaked a little inside. I didn't think much of it other than a mild irritation that the paper portion of the label was wet and ruined. I wiped it away leaving the bottle looking the worse for it and sticky with label glue.<br /><br />I put the bottle back in the bag and opened the rosehip oil I had purchased and put some onto the backs of my hands to see how it felt. Later my hands felt mildly hot and tingling. I assumed it was the oil I'd never used before and it was just a mild sensation.<br /><br />When I got home later I removed the rose and witch Hazel toner from the plastic baggie and went to open it.<br /><br />I prefer to twist the cap off to remove the outer safety seal instead of picking at it to tear it first. If it's a good seal it'll break but this one came off whole with the cap. I tore it the rest of the way off the cap. I then looked at the inner seal to see if the edge had lifted a little to cause the minor leakage.<br /><br />That's when I saw a small puncture in the center of the seal.<br /><br />I decided it looked suspicious and there was no way I was going to use it. I left it &#34;sealed&#34; from there.<br /><br />I cleaned my face, used the new rosehip oil and and went to bed awhile after that and read for awhile.<br /><br />It occurred to me there was no hot stinging sensation from the oil at all.<br /><br />I am now thinking it was not the oil that first caused it on my hands but contact with the toner that had leaked into the bag.<br /><br />I use witch hazel all the time and have never had anymore of a reaction to it than plain water and have no allergy to roses either having at times in my life from when I was a child crushed the leaves and spread them on my hands and arms.<br /><br />So, as for how the product itself works I can't say.<br /><br />I was going to leave this under product packaging reviews but the &#34;fill in the appropriate box&#34; style doesn't allow for this particular problem

  2499. this is an extremely fine with hazel preparation that I find to be very soothing and moisturizing to my skin. The rose petal addition is lovely as well.<br /><br />I put this in a glass spray bottle atomizer and I spray it directly onto my skin. It can be a bit sticky feeling if you spray it over skin already saturated with moisturizer, however I like this for saturating my skin with moisture before bed. Keeps my skin dewey moist.<br /><br />I've previously found some distilled witch hazel products to be a bit harsh or drying to my skin. But I think because this product is not distilled, and therefore retains all the skin feeding ingredients of the witch hazel, plus the addition of the rose and aloe, it makes for a genuinely nurturing formula.<br /><br />I've noted other reviews where people were put off by the scent of this product. To this I would say that it is first and foremost witch hazel that has rose assed to it. With hazel has a strong distinct scent of its own, and if you're not familiar with that, don't expect this to smell like straight rose water. It is not. It's a rose scented witch hazel and the scent of the witch hazel is definitely the predominant scent here.<br /><br />I think it's a lovely product. I feel it's very soothing and beneficial for keeping my skin moist; which for me is a definite challenge. I surely will purchase this again and again.<br /><br />I feel it's very affordable given the quality of the product as well; especially as compared to the more harsh distilled drug store varieties which lack the benefits of this formulation. It's quite concentrated and one bottle goes a long way.

  2503. Skin care has been a struggle for me for years. I've used everything from birth control pills to prescription-strength topical cream that totally dried my face out (and launched me into severe break outs as soon as I stopped using it) to homemade masks that felt nice but didn't do much against my acne. Last year, after trying a combination of Estroblock pills + black soap (loved by all internet women struggling with skin problems it seems), I had the WORST break-outs of my life.<br /><br />Desperate, I decided to cut out the expensive Estroblock pills and stop using face wash.I had read that for some skin types, soaps of ANY kind will create a never ending cycle of dried out skin followed by break outs (due to more oil being produced to make up for the dry skin). I figured I didn't have anything to lose--my skin looked horrendous.<br /><br />I dropped the pills and replaced face wash with a morning & night splash of a combined solution made up of this product + a drop of tea tree oil. Once a week I also cut off a piece of my aloe vera plant and mix the aloe with cinnamon and Manuka honey to exfoliate my face with.<br /><br />Seriously, my skin is the clearest it has ever been and my skincare regiment is the cheapest/easiest it's ever been. I've learned through my own trials and tribulations that what works for one (or even many) definitely doesn't mean it'll work for me, so I warn you not to assume this product will work wonders for you. But if face wash and topical creams aren't working, give it a try!
